name: Bewleys Hotel Manchester Airport

reviews.text: Stayed for 1 night, good sized room, very comfortable bed, everything very clean, modern bathroom. Impressed by the fact that you don't hear any noise from the airport. Friendly and lively bar in the evening. Certainly good value for money.
reviews.title: Really good

likes.liked: — Clean and modern, location right at the airport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When reading some of the reviews of airport hotels at Manchester I began to wonder if any of them were any good. Then we saw the reviews of Bewleys and decided to stay there on a park and fly deal. You won't find this one on any of the airport extras websites, you book direct on the hotel site. It proved really good value at just over £100 including 8 days parking. You park in the hotel car park rather than having to drive to another car parking site which is a system that some of the other hotels operate. It's within walking distance of Terminals 1 & 3 and there is a shuttle service to all three terminals. Check in was efficient and the staff were friendly. Our room was comfortable although we did pick up the occasional bit of aircraft noise. It certainly wasn't enough to interrupt our sleep though and I am a light sleeper. There is a large bar serving a range of reasonably priced food and drink. The bar was pretty smoke free too. We booked the shuttle bus to take us to T2 at 7.30am and it was waiting for us 10 minutes early. The journey took about 5 mins and the driver was really helpful. The hotel does a full Irish breakfast for £7 which we wished we had got up a bit earlier and had. The bacon roll and coffee at the airport was somewhat less appetising but virtually cost the same! Upon arrival back at Manchester I used the courtesy phone in arrivals to inform Bewley's of our arrival and the bus arrived within ten minutes. To be honest I can't really pick fault with anything. It was slick, effortless and trouble free, we'll definately use Bewleys again.
reviews.title: A hidden gem!

likes.liked: — Good value, efficiency of transport to airport, location

reviews.text: Thanks to trip advisor I researched this hotel before we went, and we were not dissapointed. 1st class hotel, great location, next door to the Crowne Plaza (which is more than double the price), rooms were great, very modern, clean 2 double beds, so the kids were pleased not to have a fold up camp bed thingy. Check in and out very easy. Booked the bus for pick in the morning, at the airport in less than 5 mins, same on way back, phoned and the bus came almost immediately. Left our car, no problems, would not hesitate in recommending this hotel to all, and im quite fussy about rooms, beds etc, definately a 5 Star hotel but half the price!!
reviews.title: Fantastic, Great Value For Money
location is the best for the airport
reviews.text: booked this hotel as part of a parking package. Paid £78 for hotel and a weeks parking. Have stayed here many times previously even when it was called a holiday inn. Rooms big, clean, modern. Staff helpful, nice bar, good food, sound proofed rooms, wake up service. The main advantage is price and location as you can literally walk to airport terminal. You head out of car park cross over small road and head straight for multi storey car park. There is a free transfer service from the hotel and the car park bus dropped me outside when i had dropped my car off the night before my stay. I would stay here again and would certainly recommend to others. Its a gem. Some of the other hotels nearby are a rip off compared to bewleys.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As seasoned travellers we look for quality, comfort, reasonable food, closeness to terminals and, finally, cost. We could barely believe our luck when this hotel fulfilled all our requirements. I had booked by E. Mail, speedy response made me certain that my booking was confirmed. We travelled to Manchester by train to find that the hotel was on our right moments before we entered the station. Made our way to Terminal 1, approximately 7 minutes walk, used the courtesy phone and were collected by minibus within 5 minutes. It is possible to walk from the station but heavy traffic flow means that you are in less danger if you are being driven. Check-in was smooth and efficient and within minutes of our arrival we were safely in our bedroom. The size of the room was impressive, not only did it contain a double bed but there was also a 3 seater settee and 2 easy chairs. Television, tea and coffee etc were available plus the usual last minute 'I've forgotten' things. Possibly the most appreciated discovery was that the room was totally soundproofed, no traffic noise, no aircraft noise and, definitely, no noise from other guests. The hotel boasts a fairly substantial brasserie, bar and restaurant. The bar service was excellent, the barman remembering our first order and enquiring if we wanted the same again. We ate in the restaurant and, once again, we were impressed with the quality of our meal. Many of the staff are Eastern Europeans who took great pride in their jobs and ensured that each table was well looked after. Our bill for the whole experience was, in our opinion, a joy to behold, our room was £69 for both of us and our total meal bill for 3 courses each was £35. We have stayed at many of the airport hotels, the good, the bad, the absolute pits and the very expensive. Bewleys Hotel has surpassed all the others and we shall be going back, again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A really great Hotel, very conveniently situated! Rooms fantastic, Brasserie service exceptional - wish I could remember the name of our waitress. She was top class!
reviews.title: Unhelpful and untrained Receptionist

reviews.text: Just one problem. We did not book into the Hotel, just arrived early afternoon and asked for a twin room. We were told there were none left. Only doubles. We asked whether there was a possibility that a folding bed could be placed in the room, as we cannot sleep in a double bed. We were told this was not possible and they had nothing they could give us, only the double bed.
reviews.title: Good hotel

reviews.text: As we had to have a room, we accepted the double. On entering the room, however, we immediately noticed that the sofa converted into a double bed. We set it up, and I rang Reception asking whether we could have another duvet. I was told by the Receptionist that as the Hotel was almost full, there would not be one available.
reviews.title: Refreshing Surprise by the Airport

reviews.text: I found this incredible, and unbelieveable that in a Hotel the size of Bewleys, that they would not have spare bedding! I can only assume the Receptionist was too lazy to do anything about getting us one. I also find it incredible that the Reception staff are unaware that the sofas convert into beds!
reviews.title: Bewley's - great value, good food, high comfort

reviews.text: Had a problem at check-in where they advised us they hadn't took the payment for our rooms (2) when we booked. Apparently this is standard practise, but we couldnt confirm it with our bank., (and hadnt checked beforehand...our fault)

reviews.text: stayed at this place on the 5/11/2006 due to long haul flight the following day so we neaded an early start .Everything about the hotel was spot on .The bathroom was very clean the decor was very nice the beds were very comfortable the wake up call was on time the menu was well priced and the room for the night and parking for 14 days was a lot less than what i expected to pay .this hotel could charge 200 pound a night and it would be worth it .Ipaid 109 pounds.This hotel is awesome

description: Bewley's Hotel Manchester Airport is located just minutes from terminals one and three of Manchester Airport. A complimentary shuttle service to both the airport and train stations is also provided for added convenience. Quality and value in warm friendly surroundings is what this stylish hotel is all about.
